description: From Late Middle English incessaunte, from Late Latin incessāns, incessantem, from Latin in- +‎ cessāns.

adjectives.description: incessant (comparative more incessant, superlative most incessant)

entries.meaning: Without pause or stop; not ending, especially to the point of annoyance.
examples: The dog's incessant barking kept the girl awake all night.
